Hi Ladies,  I was looking for a thread like this-- we have a similar one in the m/c forum & it's wonderful.  If there's room for one more my details are: a BFN today after a Femara/IUI cycle.  RE said we could get more aggressive with the meds next cycle.  I wouldn't mind your insights re: injectables so I can make an informed decision when I go in on CD2.  I think this was my 30th BFN & it's getting a little annoying!Congrats to all the BFPs!  You're a sign of hope.Mommyin09, thanks for pulling all this together-- wow!

Mommyin09- Thanks for starting a new thread! Our last one was getting a little long!! :)Yogachick- Welcome!! I'm sorry about your bfn today! I know how much harder it gets each month to get that -ve! I did clomid for 5 cycles, 3 with iui, all bfn. We took this cycle off b/c I had a cyst on my left ovary, but were still able to try naturally and am currently 6 dpo. When/if af shows, I'll start my first cycle of Follistim, and I am sooo excited! I always produced multiple eggs with clomid, just never got pregnant. I've read so may +ve stories about Follistim, so I'm really hoping it works in the first couple of cycles on it! I would definately say if you want to be more aggressive about ttc, which i'm sure you are :), definately move on to the injections! I could kick myself in the butt for waiting this long to start them! Good luck in whatever decision you make! :)naf- I'm sorry you've  been feeling down! :(  Hopefully you will get a +ve opk soon, and that will build your spirits up! :) I hope you do get your bfp this cycle, but if not, it may be a good break to have a few stress free cycles before actively trying again!Guesito- I sent you a message, but congrats on seeing your little one today! :) I know it put your anxiety at ease! Now just enjoy being pregnant!!!I have to check our old thread, because I think I missed out on some stuff... Be right back! ;)

Unfortunately my MIL sat next to me the whole night playing the "I'm the worlds best MIL" game. Her and I DO NOT get along.  I tried for 7 years to make her like me, and NOTHING worked. She kicked me out of her home several times and it has just been a nightmare. She accused me of lying about my m/cs, saying that I had abortions because I didn't know who the father was.  It has been terrible.  But luckily, DH has stood by me the whole time. The last time, he walked out on his family.  He told his mom that she had been given a choice to either accept me as a daughter or lose her only son.  And because she kicked me out, she'd made her choice.  We didn't speak to them for over 6 months before she finally came and appologized.  It's just been one thing after another with her. I could care less at this point.  I'm married to him, we love each other, and we WILL have a baby.  That's all that matters.Sorry for my little venting session there.Other than that everything is going well.  My momma is doing great and has started to heal quite well.As of right now, that's all I know!  Ha ha.  Have a great day everyone!

mrspace- What you're feeling is definately your follies maturing! Each month, your ovaries "race" each other to make an egg. What your feeling is them trying to mature, and the clomid really puts your ovaries into overdrive so they are working extra hard to produce 1+ mature follies! So your mom is right, and it sounds like you're getting ready to ovulate very soon! I'll check out your chart now! :)

Hey everyone!Well my temp came back down a little today. Yesterday it spiked to 97.0.  Which was a decent sized spike.  Then today it was back down to 96.4.   I have a very low normal body temp.  So I don't know.  Not sure I'll ovulate today. I want to but I doubt it.  With my temp being down like that.  But I was also told that sometimes you O later than normal when you're on clomid.  So we'll see.  I think we'll be okay with the BD patter that DH and I have had lately.  You'll have to go check it out on my tracker.   I think it's funny.Other than that, today I'm feeling really bloated and still having a lot of lower back cramping.  But other than that I'm doing great.  See, I've been on and off of anti-depressants since I was 12 years old.  My dad started sexually abusing me when I was 11 and it continued to about 2 years ago, when I turned 20 and finally moved out.  It's been a long hard road so far.  Since we're TTC I can't be on my anti-depressants.  It's a bad time for me to be off of them because I'm finally cutting my dad out of my life.  It sounds like it would be easy...but it's not.  I spent years trying to make him happy and to make him love me, even through the abuse.  It's a very hard habit to break.  To this day I still mentally degrade myself on an almost daily basis.  Just because it's what he would do.  And that voice is stuck in my head.  But with DH's help, I'm overcoming it and learning that I'm a good person and that I'm beautiful.  Well, I can't really call myself beautiful yet, but I'm getting there.  But anyway, I've been off of the anti-depressants for 6 months now and the last few days...I haven't needed them!  I have felt really good.  It sounds like no big deal but it's huge for me.  I feel like I'm at least taking steps in the right direction. Now I just have to stay strong and not deviate from my path.  It's hard. My dad calls me almost every day and leaves me messages about getting together for Christmas and so on.   It's hard not to call him back.  I still feel like I'm 11 when I talk to him.  Like, if I just do what he wants, maybe he'll love me just a little. But I have to snap out of it.  I'm not 11. I'm 22.  A grown woman.Plus, DH and I made the decision to cut him out now because once there are children involved, everything seems to get "messier".  Plus... I could never never never let him be around my children.  The thought just makes me sick to my stomach.So, happy dance for me, that I'm feeling good without medication.  And please, if you don't mind, just keep me in your thoughts with this.Thanks all.Sorry I wrote a book, but I needed to get that off my chest!

OMG! I am so sorry!!! YOU ARE a beautifull young woman!  I am happy you are doing better w/ out the meds....Try to concentrate your thoughts in YOU, dh and your goals and plans of a life together....Please keep yourself away from him......change your numbers or do something, but stay away, he needs to stop. ...............I know you already know this, and maybe you have heard it many times, and although I really don't know you....BUT I AM REALLY SURE there is nothing you could have done different, you were a child and it is not your fault..........Don't worry if he loves of you or not, you don't need that type of love, he is sick......Concentrate your efforts on loving back the ones who truely love you! My thoughts and prayers are w/ you.... HUGS

I'M SOOOOO FRUSTRATED!!!!  Just got back from my new OBGYN. Ok here's my story...1st u/s on 12/2 Saw Sac at my old( RE)2nd U/s on 12/9  with my new ob gyn Thinkd he saw a flutter not sure. Wants me to return in 3 days to confirm3rd U/S today 12/12 He's more confident he sees a flutter, also pointed spinal beginning to form..Also noticed growth from 3 days ago....Dr.curious Still wants me to come back next Friday 12/19 for another u/s he says im measuring abour a week behind! He said congratulations but.....come back next week to confirm ughhhhhhhhh!!!!I never cancelled my appt for this Tuesday with my old RE so I think im going to go to that appt to get clarification on whats goin on. I think my new obgyn is confused about my dates due to being in vitro. He's scaring me though!  My point is... IS EVERYTHING OK OR NOT????

Hi Ladies!!!Just a quick note to update you all.  Thank you SO much for all of your notes and prayers.  It means so much.  Thank you thank you!The transfer went well.  They picked the 2 "best" embryos and they were both 8 cells.  We even got a picture of them :)  I'm feeling much better than I felt after the reteival!  I'm just getting a bit bored because I have been in bed for most of the week...but it is all worth it.  So, I'm hoping and praying and praying and hoping that at least one will stick.  Come on little guys!!  My RE's clinic closes over the holidays but I am due to go for a beta test on Dec 24 (Merry Christmas??).  I will absolutely be doing an hpt before that..probaby around the 20th/21st.Luvkayln - I'm going to check out your chart but I hope you are not having an annovulatory cycle!!!  They can be very confusing, up and down.  Either way bd just to be sure!  I am also so very sorry to hear about Sean.  That is just terrible.  He was so young and we have probably all done stupid things...we just don't have to pay for them for the rest of our lives.  I really want you to get your bfp soon!  Come on O or af or whatver!!!Mrspace - How awful.  So sorry.  You are a very strong woman and sound like you have wonderful support from your dh.Candie - Those temps are great!  I really hope they stay up and you get your Christmas bfp!!!  There is a second rise in temps when you get a bfp so hopefully that was it!Mommyin09 - Hope you had a wonderful time away!  We miss you!Well...back to bed for me!  Thanks again for all your support ladies.  I will check in tomorrow!!SSBDStacey

mrspace- I'm sooo sorry for all you have been through! But like the other girls said, you are a very strong, beautiful woman! No one deserves what you went through, and you are an amazing person to walk away from that! I'm glad you are feeling better lately, and don't need your anti-depressants! Yay! I took them for a few months after having Kayln, and just when they finally started working, I stopped taking them. You're right, can't take them while ttc! I started to not depend on them, and just concentrated on the love and support I got from everyone around me, just like you have with your dh and us!! :) We love you, and are very, very proud of you!!! ((Hugs)) I hope that +ve opk gets here soon for you! I still have ewcm today, and my temps are still down, so I probably will ovulate soon. By the way, your temps are low the day you ovulate, and then spike the day after indicating that you definately ovulated the day before. So your temps being down today is not a bad thing, you may be ovulating today! :)Stacey- That's great your transfer went well, and they picked the best 2! Yay!!! I love that you got pics of them! I just know this is it for you, and your test is on the 24th! Are you kidding me!? You're going to have the best Christmas EVER!!!! :)Mommyin09- I'm so glad you're back!! We missed you! :)Candie- That's awesome your temps are high today at 7 dpo! I sure hope this is it for you sweetie! :) I'll check out your chart in a minute!Guesito- I'm sorry your new doc is a quack and is mixing up your dates! I'm sure everything is just fine with the baby, and he just is confused because you did invitro! I know it's hard not to worry. I say definately go to your appointment you never cancelled with your old RE, he knows what's going on and knows your dates and everything. I'll be thinking of you, and just have faith! I hope your fears are tossed away after Tuesday! I know it'll be a long weekend for you now, maybe try to call them and see if you can get in earlier?? Tell them your concerns, and i'm sure they'll understand!

mommyin09- We missed you!  And we're so glad you have you back.  I'm glad everything is going so well for you.  My fingers are defiantely crossed.luvkayln- Thanks for the kind words.  It is something I struggle with every single day.  But I'm doing really well.  I really hope that I'm ovulating today.  I forgot to take my OPK on my lunch break so I'm making DH bring it to me at work.  Ha ha.   It's important though! I'm still having some cramping.  My cm is still really watery, so I don't know.  We will just have to see. My next appointment is on the 22nd, so hopefully we'll have some answers soon.  I know we won't find out if we're pg at the appointment, it'll be too early.  But maybe she can help me interpurret (wow sp) my charts.  I hope you O soon hun!  My fingers are crossed for you.guesito- I'm sorry that your new doctor is confused, and confusing you in the process.  I hope that the weekend goes by quickly so that you can go in and get more answers next week!keyan- thank you so much for your kind words.  I know that when I saw "sexually abused" everyone tends to assume rape.  I wasn't raped by my father.  I'll make that point clear.  But you're right.  He's a sick man.  And I know that it doesn't make sense for me to want to make him happy after all this time, but like I said...old habits die hard. It's very difficult for me.  DH has been so amazing.  We had a major break through just after our wedding (in Sept).  I was able to sleep with the bedroom door open.  DH even baked me cookies the next day to celebrate!  Ha ha.  It was great.  But it'll all be okay.  I know it will.  I'm taking the steps that I need to now.candie- That's awesome that your temps are up.  Sounds like a good sign to me.  I will be keeping my fingers crossed for you!!Again, thanks to everyone for the kind words.

I had to cancel my appoingtment yesterday...the eather was really bad here and the roads were all flooded, so I re-schduled for tomorrow.  That means I have to wait all weekend to get the results since my RE's office is closed on Sunday's.That S U C K S!! Maybe next week?Joyce ~ I think the high levels of HCG make you have crazy dreams...I am still having them almost every night.  Although my dreams have shifted focus from baby to Christmas.  Last night I had a dream I went to a flea market and I was looking all over for a green Hawaiian quilted tree skirt?!?!?  I never found one...I woke up bummed, LOL

Michelle- I'm sorry you have to wait till Monday to find out your results. :(  Your levels really are dropping pretty quickly. Quicker than what they said they would drop, so I bet they'll be down to 0 by next week, or at the latest the week after. Stay strong, I know how hard this is ((Hugs)) After I had Kayln, I did nothing but take sleeping pills, but not b/c I couldn't sleep, but b/c I didn't want to be awake. Your dream about the tree skirt is adorable! I'm sorry you never found one! :) I know you just want these levels to drop to 0 so you can start healing emotionally/physically and start trying again in a few months. The new year will bring you another baby, I just know it! :)So, Kayln's birthday is wednesday, I can't believe it's already here! :(  A lady that I work with that was always buying Kayln things when I was pregnant gave me her birthday present yesterday! It's an angel leaning on this ball, and it's a solar light. So during the night, her wings and the ball light up. She said it's her angel to look over her at night! :(  I just thought that was sooooo sweet of her to do that! We're all meeting at the cemetary on Wednesday at 3:00 to say a prayer and to wish her a happy birthday. Sean's aunt wrote her a really sweet poem, so I'm going to print it out and laminate it so it can stay out there with her too. It'll be a sad day, but I'm greatful that the whole family will be there to celebrate her birthday with us! I know i'll talk to you all before wednesday, but if you can just remember to keep her in your thoughts I would really appreciate it! :)Well, my temps are still down this morning but I still have ewcm today when I wiped so O must be coming soon! I keep saying/hoping that anyways!! :) I've got my meds just waiting for me, and watch i'll end up pregnant this time and not even need these meds! Wishful thinking!! :) At least I know a few girls here that would be willing to take it off my hands! :)

Good afternoon ladies.I hope everyone is having a great weekend.  I have been very lazy which is good :)  My sister came to visit yesterday and we had a really nice time.  I haven't seen her since her horse passed away so it was nice to support each othere with everything we are going through.  I have been living in my PJs and having a lot of naps!  So hopefully this will help my little guys stick.  I feel the same as I have for most of the week - bloated with sore bbs.  I am also on progesterone and estrogen which are probably causing some of this.Mommyin09 - Glad to have you back and glad you had a nice little trip with dh.  I think it is so important to celebrate occasions like that!  How are you feeling?  Can you believe you are almost half way through the tww??Luvkayln - I will definitely be thinking of you and Kayln on Wednesday.  I know it will be a sad day for you and dh :( and it is so wonderful that your family will be there to celebrate the date and support you.  The angel sounds precious.Guesito - Congrats again.  The pics look great.  That little guy/gal is definitely growing!  I'm sure your appt this week will reassure you that everything is just fine.Candie - Praying for you friend!  I really hope that you get your bfp this week!!Arlotheslug - Still thinking of and missing you!  Come back when you are ready.Shyshana - What's the news??  Bfp??Keyan - I hope your u/s went well!!Well enjoy the rest of your Sunday friends and hope that we see some more bfps this week!Stacey

Today is rough for me.  2 yrs ago I lost my Mom.  I have tried to stay busy.Yesterday wasn't better.  RE and I decided that today is CD 3 because Thursday I thought I started, but then stopped.  So, tmw.(MON) I will be CD 4.  Since I started seeing my RE I have had a cyst on my right.  It hasn't gotten any bigger nor smaller.  Yesterday, that cyst or whatever it may be was on the right along with another.  On the left I had a huge cyst (over 60).  We were amazed... when I went in on CD 15 & 17 nothing was even on the left.  Where could that have come from?  The last 2 cycles (the ones I have been with my RE) I have O'd from my blocked side.  This cycle, I cannot take clomid of course.  I am very disappointed.  This would have been a great cycle to be more aggressive since I have a full 2 weeks off of school.  Now, I started BC.  I have pre-op on 12/29 and a LAP. on 12/30.  She said she normally would wait a couple of more months, but since I have this time off of work now would be a good time to go in a see what is going on.   So, what have your experiences been with Lap?  She said that we could start TTC again the next cycle?  I have heard that after this surgery and after getting of BC you can be more fertile. True? I am so lost....

question: A Strong Woman VS. A Woman Of StrengthA strong woman works out everyday to keep her body in shape…But a woman of strength builds relationships to keep her soul in shape.A strong woman isn't afraid of anything…But a woman of strength shows courage in the midst of fear.A strong woman won't let anyone get the better of her…But a woman of strength gives the best of herself to everyone.A strong woman makes mistakes and avoids the same in the future…A woman of strength realiizes life's mistakes can also be unexpected blessings and capitalizes on them.A strong woman wears a look of confidence on her face…But a woman of strength wears grace.A strong woman has faith that she is strong enough for the journey…But a woman of strength has faith that it is in the journey that she will become strong.Author Unknown************************************************Michelle:  (Offer support & prayers!!!)Leighanne: BFP - 28 weeks (u/s 12/6)vortex: BFP - 19 weeks (u/s,12/2)Joyce: BFP - 13 weeks (doc appt 12/16)icierain: BFPJessie:  BFP 8 weeksArmyprincess: BFP - 6? title: Calling all Women of Strength...
